name: RetrievePayrollPositions
description:
Retrieve payroll input group positions for parameter values.

This tool retrieves instances of payroll input group positions that can be used as parameter values in other Workday API endpoints. It's useful when you need to specify valid positions for payroll-related operations.

parameters.name: end_date_for_positions
parameters.description: The end date for the positions using the format yyyy-mm-dd.

value_schema.description: The end date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: max_objects_per_response
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of objects returned in a single response, up to 1000.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: response_offset
parameters.description: Zero-based start index for response collection; use with 'limit' for paging.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: pay_component_id
parameters.description: The ID for the pay component. Use an ID returned from GET/values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents.

value_schema.description: The pay component for the worktags. You can use a returned id from GET/values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents.

parameters.name: start_date_for_positions
parameters.description: The start date for the positions in yyyy-mm-dd format.

value_schema.description: The start date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: worker_id
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker. Retrieve this ID using GET /workers in the Staffing service.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the worker. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Workday API

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

value_schema.description: The end date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: payComponent
parameters.description: The pay component for the worktags. You can use a returned id from GET/values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents.

value_schema.description: The pay component for the worktags. You can use a returned id from GET/values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

value_schema.description: The start date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the worker. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service.
